page.title: 04King's Sutton Manor History
page.content: There is supposed to be an underground tunnel to the church from the house but they have not found it yet. In King's Sutton long ago there used to be several lepers. Leprosy was an extremely bad skin disease. In the Manor there are two holes situated in the cellar. The people of the house left scraps from dinner and the lepers would collect them. It was important that the people did not touch the lepers. The window was sometimes called The Alms Window. Alms means charity. We had never heard of leprosy and one of our group thought it was a story about leopards! There are several old doors made of thick oak. Some are covered in green baize. The doors are very thick so the noises from the kitchen could not be heard.
